traits.name: False Appearance
entries: If the groff is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the groff move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the groff isn't an ordinary moss-covered bog patch.

traits.name: Hold Breath
entries: The groff can hold its breath for up to 1 hour.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The groff makes one Bite attack and one Swamp Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
entries: Melee atk +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 9 (1d8 + 5 damage) piercing damage.

actions.name: Swamp Claw
entries: Melee atk +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. 8 (1d6 + 5 damage) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or become engulfed by the groff. While engulfed, the target can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 10 (3d6 damage) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. When the groff moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The groff can have only one target engulfed at a time.
An engulfed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns. On a success, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space.
